events.name: Welcome Speakers & Participants of FOSSASIA Summit in Singapore
events.description: Let's welcome speakers and participants of the FOSSASIA Summit in Singapore and start to exchange about cool ideas and projects. You will also meet FOSSASIA team members Justin, Gabriel and Yiyang and enjoy the view over Singapore from the 22nd floor from Microsoft's Singapore office during an office tour. Coffee and snacks are also provided by our friendly host. AGENDA 10:00 to 10:30 - Arrive, Network, Talk10:30 to 11:00 - Welcome to FOSSASIA Summit11:00 to 11:30 - Self Introductions11:30 to 12:00 - Tour around office12:00 to 13:00 - Network, free and easy TICKETS The FOSSASIA Summit takes place from 17-19th March in the Science Centre. Please get your ticket here: https://eventyay.com/e/45da88b7/ (https://eventyay.com/e/45da88b7/) LINKS FOSSASIA: http://2017.fossasia.org (http://2017.fossasia.org) Twitter: https://twitter.com/fossasia (https://twitter.com/fossasia) Justin Lee: https://twitter.com/triplez82 (https://twitter.com/triplez82) Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/events/1874873046058383/ (https://www.facebook.com/events/1874873046058383/)

events.name: Culture & Exploration Afternoon with FOSSASIA speakers and dinner at Lau Pa Sat
events.description: Join FOSSASIA summit speakers and participants from around the world for a cultural and tech walk in Singapore and dinner at Lau Pa Sat. We will begin our afternoon at National Design Center for a short introduction to Singapore tech and start-up scene by Pixel Labs Then let's all head out together for the cultural tour, where you will have a chance to visit some historic buildings and landmarks of Singapore. At the end we will have dinner at Lau Pa Sat. Nayana from the FOSSASIA team will be your guide. If you don't find us, please call Nayana at +65 9430 3707 AGENDA 3.30 pm: Welcome and networking  4.00 pm: Introduction to Tech Communities and Local startup ecosystem 5.00 pm: Start the culture walk. Visit some historic buildings and landmarks of Singapore: National Library, War Memorial Park, Esplanade Theater, etc. 6.30 pm: Dinner at Lau Pa Sat 9.00 pm: Let’s get some drinks just after dinner at a nearby bar.  10.00 pm: Head to hotel What to bring (Optional) 1. Water2. Footwear for walking3. Cap, Umbrella, Raincoat4. Notebook, Pen, Camera5. Cash for dinner Links FOSSASIA: http://fossasia.org Twitter: https://twitter.com/fossasia
events.location: IMDA Pixel Labs@NDC | National Design Centre , 111 Middle Road S(88969), Singapore (map)

events.name: Content Workshop - MOE Learning Buildathon 2017
events.description:
The Content Workshop (16 March) is designed give participants an insight into the challenges of the first-ever MOE Learning Buildathon (25-26 March). You will have the chance to hear from experts on the challenges and innovative approaches toward creating engaging and viral content.
You will apply Design Thinking principles to start thinking about your own approach and solution to address the Buildathon challenges. Additionally, this will be your chance to meet like-minded innovators and form your team!
Watch this space for more information about the workshop, coming soon!
Also, check out the Tech Workshop (Tuesday evening, 21 March), where the likes of Microsoft and Apple will introduce the tools they’ve lined up to help you bring your ideas to life at the Buildathon!

If you have any questions, please send us an email at hello@upsingapore.com.
events.location: LEVEL3, Mapletree Business City, East Wing,, 20 Pasir Panjang Road, #03-22/24, Singapore 117439

events.name: Reproducible Data Science with Pachyderm
events.description:
Pachyderm is a data lake that offers complete version control for data and leverages the container ecosystem to provide reproducible data processing.



Meetup Summary

As data scientists, we know the best ideas come through collaboration. We also know reproducibility matters. Pachyderm makes both a reality, and this talk shows how. We’ll talk about data containers and analysis pipelines, and how they combine to make Pachyderm a Git for Data Science. 



6.30pm - 7.00pm :  Networking

7.00pm - 7.40pm : Pachyderm - Git for Data Science by Najib Ninaba

Najib will share an overview of Pachyderm, infrastructure requirements and a quick demo of the installation and how-to.

 7.50pm - 8.30pm : Using Pachyderm with R

Jeanne will share how a typical data scientist working with R and his/her datasets will be use Pachyderm to ensure reproducibility. 

About the speakers:

Najib Ninaba has been involved in High Performance Computing since 2000 and has been at the inflection point of Cloud and Analytics. Products he has managed and delivered includes Scalable Rocks, Platform Cluster Manager, Revolution Analytics's CloudR and RevoR integration into Cloudera Manager. 

Jeanne Choo comes from the world of biology and small data - think coral reef, beaver, and plant gene datasets, painstakingly collected. Currently a big data mage apprentice.

events.name: SGInnovate: Blockchain Nights
events.description:
Hi all, reposting on SGInnovate behalf, they have an awesome event with great speakers , happening on 16th of March night as part of their Blockchain Nights @ SG Innovate initiative. Come by, give a shoutout and learn from the speakers! 



Speaker 1 – Toby Hoenisch, CEO of Onepay on the COMIT protocol for off-chain multi-asset transactions Speaker 2 – Hrishi Olickel, previously from Dinardirham 




6:30pm: Registration 7-8:30pm: Speaking Segments After 8.30pm – Paid event for beer with Ethereum Singapore at the mezzanine area (cost to be paid directly to Ethereum Singapore at $10 for beers) 


Please RSVP as well to the signup eventbrite here. 


 


Regards, SG Innovate and Ethereum Singapore

events.name: Data Warehousing with Big Query and Dataflow
events.description:
Data Warehousing with Big Query and Dataflow BigQuery is a core part of Google Cloud Platform's data and analytics solution. BigQuery’s serverless architecture continues to redefine what it means to be fully managed. It scales seamlessly, analyzes terabytes of data in seconds and supports concurrent data queries for large organizations, without requiring capacity provisioning or systems tuning. As always, BigQuery is highly available, and encrypts all data at rest. Learn how to migrate, transform, and monitor your data into GCP with Big Query and Dataflow. This talk will cover the steps involved for moving your data warehouse, considerations, and provide an approach for project success. We will also dive into Python code for some hands on demonstrations. Time : 7pm to 9pm (please be punctual, will start on time ;)) Speaker : Andrew Stevens Our volunteer speaker for this session is Andrew Stevens. He has brought Dataflow and Big Query to many production systems . He will be sharing his experiences and knowledge in this area for us. 


Info :  Short Video of What is Big Query :  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eyBK9nj-7AA&t=22s What is Dataflow : https://cloud.google.com/dataflow/
events.location: Google Asia Pacific , Mapletree Business City, 70 Pasir Panjang Rd, Singapore 117 371
events.group_name: Google Cloud Platform User Group Singapore

events.name: talk.js
events.description: Agenda 7.00pm: Doors open - mingle with pizzas and drinks 7.30pm: Opening address by host 7.40pm: Start of scheduled talks 8.45pm: Open announcements 9.00pm: End of event Talks - PrimeReact: UI component library for React by Sudheer Jonna- Compiling to JavaScript with Scala.js by Li Haoyi- Easy React Native using Exponent by Simon Sturmer An open announcement is when anyone can make an announcement about a new meet up, job opportunities, upcoming events, or something you learnt. If you have a short announcement you'd like to share with the audience, you may do so during the open announcements segment. Important Please remember to bring a photo ID to get through building security (e.g. driver's license, passport, etc.) Sponsor(s) Venue sponsor: PayPal Food and drink sponsor: PayPal
events.location: PayPal Singapore, Suntec Tower 5, 5 Temasek Boulevard #09-01

events.name: Reproducible Data Science with Pachyderm and R
events.description:
Pachyderm is a data lake that offers complete version control for data and leverages the container ecosystem to provide reproducible data processing. 

As data scientists, we know the best ideas come through collaboration. We also know reproducibility matters. Pachyderm makes both a reality, and this talk shows how. We’ll talk about data containers and analysis pipelines, and how they combine to make Pachyderm a Git for Data Science.  

6.30pm - 7.00pm : Networking 

7.00pm - 7.40pm : Pachyderm - Git for Data Science by Najib Ninaba Najib will share an overview of Pachyderm, infrastructure requirements and a quick demo of the installation and how-to. 

7.50pm - 8.30pm : Using Pachyderm with R Jeanne will share how a typical data scientist working with R and his/her datasets will be use Pachyderm to ensure reproducibility. 


About the speakers: 

Najib Ninaba has been involved in High Performance Computing since 2000 and has been at the inflection point of Cloud and Analytics. Products he has managed and delivered includes Scalable Rocks, Platform Cluster Manager, Revolution Analytics's CloudR and RevoR integration into Cloudera Manager. 

Jeanne Choo comes from the world of biology and small data - think coral reef, beaver, and plant gene datasets, painstakingly collected. Currently a big data mage apprentice.
events.location: IDA Labs Level 2 @ National Design Centre, 111 Middle Road, #02-04, Singapore

events.name: March Meetup
events.description:
Hi friends!   We're thrilled to have another Elixir meetup on Thursday, 16th March 2017. Learn more about Elixir in 2017! 


Programme  7.00pm: Doors open - mingle over food and drinks 7.20pm: Start of session, opening address by hosts 7.30pm: Start of scheduled talks 9:00pm: Community announcements / End of event 


Scheduled Talks • 'Writing and Publishing Elixir Libraries' by Yos • Slot available! 


Information for Attendees **Please bring a photo ID to get through building security!** The meetup will be held at Thoughtworks Singapore, 18 Cross Street #11-08. If you're traveling by MRT, the closest MRT station is DT18 Telok Ayer. 


Sponsors Food and venue: Thoughtworks  Thank you to all our sponsors!
events.location: ThoughtWorks , 18 cross street #11-08 China Sq Central (S)048423, Singapore

events.name: Emacs Meetup #4
events.description:
Hello folks! We're finally back with meetup #4! Here are the details: 


Date: 16th March, 2017, 7.30pm Location: Pivotal Labs, Singapore                    140 Robinson Road, Level 16                    Singapore[masked] 


Thank you Pivotal Labs for sponsoring the venue once again. NOTE: Pivotal Labs have moved, so be sure to go to the correct location! **Please bring a photo ID to get through building security!** Talks:  Dired in Depth - Jethro Kuan Dired is the de-facto file navigation interface for Emacs. If mastered, Dired will prove to be another indispensible tool. Learn file navigation the Emacs way, and never default to your system file manager again! 


There'll be no food provided, but I guarantee lots of Emacs banter!
events.location: Pivotal Labs, Singapore, 140 Robinson Road, Level 16

events.name: ArtScience Late: Syndicate
events.description:
Catch Syndicate Live at ArtScience Late 
Thursday, 16 March | 8pm
Expression Gallery, Level 4
Free

Singapore's foremost forward-thinking audiovisual collective Syndicate SG will perform live on 16 March, 8pm at ArtScience Late. 

Syndicate's work breaks down the boundaries that separate science, faith, art, and magic. Visitors can look forward to experimental music and visuals, building on the themes explored in Syndicate's new i Light commission, Secret Galaxies. Expect a spell-binding evening of cosmology, astrological myths, galactic sounds and interstellar visuals

As part of I Light Marina Bay 2017, Syndicate will take over ArtScience Museum's iconic façade from 3 to 26 March, bringing it to life with a spectacular new projection-mapping artwork, Secret Galaxies. With inspiration from ancient Greek and Roman mythology, Secret Galaxies transforms the exterior of the museum into a dynamic representation of the stars and planets above us.  

#ilightmarinabay #ArtScienceLate #artsciencemuseum

http://po.st/ASL
